page.title: 19A Stalker's day in June
page.content: {Most of the land in our block is owned {by the Buccleuch Estates and the woods {and the small bit of moor included are {used for pheasant, grouse and deer {shooting. Here is the diary of Mr {William Bell, a Buccleuch Estates deer {stalker for a typical day in June. { {4.30}Get up, check weather.If fine and clear have cup of coffee, toast whilst checking rifle, ammunition,binoculars etc.Then proceed to ground we intend to stalk, as planned previously. We must have several options here,as it depends on wind direction where we go,as deer must always be stalked up wind. Whilst stalking we attempt to cull the old or weakly deer. We continue to stalk until about 7.30_8am as by that time most of the deer will have gone back to thick cover.{Cont page 20}
